chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian E Matavka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed/sign releases.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample if not yet previously done.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christian E Matavka in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT                   **Concurrent with present sentence** 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
  
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

NOTE:  DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH
Dated 05/24/16, from Atty Weathers to Judge Carter, requesting adjournment of 07/28/16 hearing.   NOTE: Atty Weathers advised that she does NOT have a conflict on this date.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
